description: A car with four doors and a separate trunk.
A car with two doors and a fixed roof.
A car with a rear door that swings upward to open.
A car with a roof that can be folded or removed.
A large vehicle with off-road capabilities and high seating.
A boxy car designed for transporting families with sliding side doors.
A device that increases engine power by forcing extra air into the combustion chamber.
A car powered by a combination of an internal combustion engine and an electric motor.
The group of components that deliver power to the driving wheels.
The car's framework that supports the body and engine.
An attachment on a car that helps reduce air resistance or 'drag'.
A chamber in the engine where fuel is burned to create power.
A system that transmits power from the engine to the wheels.
A rod or spindle passing through the center of a wheel or group of wheels.
A mechanism for connecting and disconnecting the engine and transmission.
A device for cooling the engine by circulating liquid through it.
An instrument that measures the distance traveled by a vehicle.
A gauge that shows the engine's RPM (revolutions per minute).
A system that automatically controls the speed of a vehicle.
Wheels made from a mixture of metals, typically lighter and stronger than steel.
A set of gears allowing the wheels to spin at different speeds while turning.
A device that sprays fuel into the engine's combustion chamber.
A device that forces air into the engine to increase power.
Short for turbocharger, it boosts engine power by recycling exhaust gases.
Anti-lock Braking System prevents the wheels from locking up during braking.
